alert.note: Alert for Central Horry; Coastal Horry; Northern Horry (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 2:19PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...An area of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Brunswick, south central Columbus and central Horry Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 218 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of strong thunderstorms near Hammond, or 9 miles northwest of North Myrtle Beach Airport, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Myrtle Beach, North Myrtle Beach, Surfside Beach, Sunset Beach, Myrtle Beach Airport, Socastee, Red Hill, Little River, Springmaid Pier, North Myrtle Beach Airport, Cherry Grove Inlet, Iredell, Carolina Shores, Loris, Calabash, Nixonville, Barefoot Landing Area Of North Myrtle Beach, Wampee, Goretown and Cherry Grove Beach. This includes the following highways... US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 1 and 5. SC Highway 31 between mile markers 5 and 24. SC Highway 22 between mile markers 14 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Horry; Coastal Horry; Northern Horry
